Rulings.Cat:
● You can't activate 'Dark Bribe' if your opponent has no cards remaining in his/her Deck.
● If your opponent activates a Spell/Trap Card outside of his/her Draw Phase (Chain Link 1) and you negate its activation and effect with 'Dark Bribe' (Chain Link 2), after your opponent draws a card with the effect of 'Dark Bribe' you can activate (flip face-up) 'Appropriate', because the activation of your opponent's Spell/Trap Card is negated by 'Dark Bribe'.

Rulings.Base:
1. This effect does not target.
2. You cannot activate this card if your opponent has no cards in their Deck.
3. Both parts of this card's effect are considered to resolve at the same time.
4. If this card is activated as Chain Link 2 negating a Spell or Trap Card, the negated effect will not be resolved, so the Chain is over after the opponent draws 1 card.

PSCT.Edison:
① If your opponent activates a Spell/Trap Card: 
They draw 1 card, also you negate the activation, and if you do, destroy it.
